item.name: 1960: The Making of the President
item.comment: Initial rating

item.name: The Adventurers: The Pyramid of Horus
The Adventurers: The Temple of Chac
Agricola: Chłopi i ich zwierzyniec
item.originalname: Agricola: All Creatures Big and Small

item.name: Blokus Trigon
item.comment: Best with 3

item.name: Carcassonne
item.comment: A very nice tile-laying, light strategy perfect for wives/girlfriends. Works very well with 2 people.

item.name: Carcassonne: Abbey & Mayor
item.comment: Least favourite

item.name: Carcassonne: Expansion 1 – Inns & Cathedrals
item.comment: Should be included in the basic game. If you own Carc., you definitely should buy Inns&Cathedrals.

item.name: Carcassonne: Expansion 2 – Traders & Builders
item.comment: Essentially, it's still good, old Carcassonne with a nice twist (i.e. gathering resources) and a handful of new tiles. Plus a bag :-)

item.name: Carcassonne: The Princess & the Dragon
item.comment: Goes too far against the spirit of original Carcassonne. Play it only with 3+ people.

item.name: Commands and Colors: Ancients
item.comment: Slightly better than Memoir, thanks to :1. The theme 2. Deeper gameplay. Plays longer though.

item.name: Cytadela
item.comment:
As a game for 2 players only it's not very impressive, too predictable. Well, have to play it more. With 4+ players it gets a bit longer but also more interesting and funny. Good party game!
UPDATE: played it with different groups of 2-6 people, mostly non-gamers. Was it a blast! Consequently, my rating goes up from 7 to 8
UPDATE: And down it goes to 7 again. BTW: What's the best way to choose a character? Shuffle them and pick one up at random.

item.name: Descent: Wędrówki w mroku (Druga edycja)
item.originalname: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition)

item.name: Dobble
item.comment: quick, tense, fun. With 3-5 players I will always pick this one over Wits and Wagers/Jungle Speed

item.name: Dominion
item.comment: Very entertaining with any number of players. Excellent as a 2-player game.

item.name: Dominion: Black Market Promo Card
item.comment: no thanks

item.name: Dominion: Intrigue
item.comment: Thumbs up

item.name: Dominion: Seaside
item.comment: Yes, yes, yes

item.name: Doom: The Boardgame
item.comment: Lots of tactical decisions and tons of fun with the right group of people. I'm not really sure if Descent made this one obsolete, the two are still pretty much different. Thumbs up!

item.name: Dungeon Twister
item.comment: Excellent! Should you happen to be a chess player, plus a fantasy/RPG enthusiast, plus you used to play/like Stratego, then you WILL love Dungeon Twister. Magnificent!

item.name: Dungeon Twister 2: Prison
item.comment: Needless to say, it deserves a solid 9.

item.name: Dungeoneer: Dragons of the Forsaken Desert
Dungeoneer: Realm of the Ice Witch
Dungeoneer: Tomb of the Lich Lord
item.comment: It feels a bit like an RPG for 11-year olds

item.name: DungeonQuest (third edition)
item.comment: combat only with the variant rules

item.name: Dungeons & Dragons Dice Masters: Battle for Faerûn
Dungeons & Dragons: Castle Ravenloft Board Game
Dungeons & Dragons: The Legend of Drizzt Board Game
Dungeons & Dragons: Wrath of Ashardalon Board Game
Dżungla
item.comment: good with kids

item.name: Earth Reborn
item.comment: Each and every scenario is a story in itself, different each time you play it. Great

item.name: Fauna junior
item.comment: As the name suggests, only for kids. But as such, it delivers

item.name: Filary Ziemi Rozszerzenie
item.originalname: The Pillars of the Earth: Expansion Set

item.name: FITS
item.comment: Not a really good game, quite repetitive, works well with kids

item.name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game
Gears of War: Gra Planszowa
item.originalname: Gears of War: The Board Game

item.name: Geniusz
item.comment: I play it mostly only with kids, and as time goes, the games are more and more tense. Excellent

item.name: Ghost Stories
item.comment:
The more players participate, the better. Simple mechanics, nice gameplay, lots of tension, moderate difficulty. Also, nice theme! After many plays I believe its pretty much solvable on normal difficulty and the element of luck can and should be mostly eliminated.
As with all the coops, there's a problem with overdominant players. Solution: give advice to other players only when on the same/adjacet tile. Becomes a bit more difficult, but ultimately more fun and rewarding when you win.

item.name: Hero: Immortal King – The Lair of the Lich
Heroscape Expansion Set: Fortress of the Archkyrie
Heroscape Master Set: Battle for the Underdark
Heroscape Master Set: Rise of the Valkyrie
item.comment:
What a game, what a phenomenal experience and an inspiration for building heroic stories. My first 10 is coming, and it's coming fast.
UPDATE: Nope, it's not a 10

item.name: Heroscape Master Set: Swarm of the Marro
In the Year of the Dragon
Jenga
item.comment: Becomes old very quickly. Even kids get tired with it pretty fast.

item.name: Jungle Speed
item.comment: Dobble is way better

item.name: Last Night on Earth: Growing Hunger
item.comment: Essential

item.name: Last Night on Earth: Survival of the Fittest
Last Night on Earth: The Zombie Game
item.comment:
Had to lower the score. The game's fun factor depends heavily on the group you play the game with, as well as on the zombie player's attitude. I guess I have also played too much of it recently, so it got a bit tedious.
UPDATE. We had a really good zombie player last time, with all the "urghhs" and "braaains", plus a really good scenario (Defend the Mansion). It turned out to be the best LNoE experience I'd ever had.

item.name: Loch Ness
item.comment: Kids only, 5&7 had a blast

item.name: The Lord of the Rings: Strategy Battle Game
item.comment: Excellent with kids + the theme. Yes, the theme makes it a great game

item.name: Lord of the Rings: The Confrontation
Lord of the Rings: The Confrontation (Deluxe Edition)
item.comment: I'm not sure about the balance, it seems Sauron pl has a significant advantage over the overly weak Fellowship pl, but that could also mean I need to play it more. Which I will, as it's a superb game.

item.name: Lost Cities
item.comment:
The filler for 2
UPDATE: Biblios is much better

item.name: Marvel Dice Masters: Avengers vs. X-Men
Memoir '44
item.comment: It is good, seriously. Provided you are not a die-hard wargamer. Plus it's quick, and clever, and lots and lots of fun. You can play it with virtually anybody. Tis a decent game, value for money as they say.

item.name: Mr. Jack
item.comment:
Light strategy game with a lot of tension and tons of neat features that seems to be a hit amongst non-gamers, even though it's surely unbalanced.
UPDATE. After some devastating defeats by the detective, I've finally managed to score a spectacular win with Mr Jack.

item.name: My First Carcassonne
item.comment: As long as you play it with kids up to 7yo - it works. Play it with older group, and it fails miserably

item.name: New World: A Carcassonne Game
item.comment: Much worse than the original. Too fast, too unpredictable, too random. Hovewer, it depicts moving west very well. So, a bit educational.

item.name: Puerto Rico
item.comment: Initial, it'll probably go up

item.name: Quarto!
item.comment: kids only

item.name: RattleSnake
item.comment: makes my brain hurt

item.name: Rattus: Spiel 2010 Bonus Cards
item.comment: nevermore

item.name: Roll Through the Ages: The Bronze Age
San Juan
item.comment: Compared to Race for the Galaxy... it is ultimately a better game and experience. Works wonderfully well as a two player game. Tense, strategic, fast and thematic (sort of). I will always choose this one over the RftG.

item.name: Shadows over Camelot
item.comment: After two games (no traitors, one game won) it seems to me SoC isn't as impressive as I was told - and I was told it is a blast. It's still lots of fun though.

item.name: Small World: Grand Dames of Small World
Stratego Original
item.comment: Played it a lot as a kid, now playing with the kids. It feels good

item.name: Tide of Iron
item.comment: If it were just a bit shorter... with slighlty lower setup time. Would that be a game.

item.name: Tikal
item.comment: Becomes a major pain if you play it with undecisive and mathy players. Otherwise, a great game

item.name: Time's Up!
item.comment: Best party game, ever, period

item.name: Tomb
item.comment:
It certainly meets my needs as to a light, highly customizable dungeon crawl with a decent amount of interaction. And the characters!
But. You need to accept a very high 'in your face' factor. Negative interaction may turn out to be a major nuisance.
Plus. It can get really random and frustrating.

item.name: Tomb: Cryptmaster
item.comment: Tomb on steroids

item.name: A Touch of Evil: Hero Pack 1
A Touch of Evil: Hero Pack 2
A Touch of Evil: Something Wicked Expansion
A Touch of Evil: The Coast
A Touch of Evil: The Supernatural Game
item.comment:
A true ameritrash dice fest, much too random, can therefore get extremely frustrating. And the vampire on the box, yikes.
Update: went from 5 to 8 over time. Expansions!

item.name: Ubongo
item.comment: Excellent family game. Very good with kids.

item.name: Ucieczka: Świątynia zagłady
item.originalname: Escape: The Curse of the Temple
item.comment: Played with kids 8&11, too chaotic, but still fun

item.name: Warhammer Fantasy Battle: Battle For Skull Pass
Warhammer Fantasy Battle: The Island of Blood
item.comment: Much too random, time consuming. Not really a game, but a hobby

item.name: Wilki i owce
item.comment: Seems to be a good gateway for young non-gamers. Works well with 2-3 people, but fails at 4.

item.name: Wits & Wagers
item.comment: Wow! Great family game for all ages!

item.name: Władca Pierścieni: Gra Karciana
item.originalname: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game
